sentences.sContent: She wouldn't understand the hint, but followed me to a sideboard, where I went to lay my bonnet, and importuned me in a whisper to give her directly what I had brought.
sentences.sContent_eng: She wouldn't understand the hint, but followed me to a sideboard, where I went to lay my bonnet, and importuned me in a whisper to give her directly what I had brought.
sentences.sCn: 她不懂这个暗示，却跟着我到一个餐具柜那儿，我是到那儿放下我的帽子的，她低声央求我把我所带来的东西马上给她。

sentences.sContent: Instead, I fainted and hit my head on the sideboard, my last thought before passing out being that maybe if I hit myself hard enough I would get a couple of days in bed. A while off school.
sentences.sContent_eng: Instead, I fainted and hit my head on the sideboard, my last thought before passing out being that maybe if I hit myself hard enough I would get a couple of days in bed. A while off school.
sentences.sCn: 我想要对他们都表示感谢，但我却昏倒了，头撞在了食具柜上，在我即将昏迷的那一瞬，我最后的念头是，如果撞得足够厉害，或许可以卧床休息一两天，那样可以有几天不用去学校，并能使别人对我稍加观注。

trans.tranOther: a long low piece of furniture usually in a  dining room  , used for storing plates, glasses etc
